Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant PARK2 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant parkin (p.C351Y) showed 60% reduced protein expression compared to wild-type.
Mutant parkin (p.C351S) exhibited 55% reduced protein stability.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare group means.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression â‰¥ 80% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were co-transfected with reporter plasmids and PARK2 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: p.C351Y mutant showed 30% increased transcriptional activity compared to wild-type.
p.C351S mutant exhibited 25% increased transcriptional activity.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to compare mutant vs. wild-type groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Transcriptional activity within 10% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: Brain tissue from patients with PARK2 mutations was analyzed for parkin localization.

Readout description.Result Description: p.C351Y mutant showed cytoplasmic accumulation of parkin instead of mitochondrial localization.
p.C351S mutant exhibited reduced mitochondrial localization and increased cytoplasmic retention.

Biological replicates.Description: Five patient samples with the same mutation were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: No technical replicates were explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: Control brain tissue from healthy donors was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: No staining was performed without primary antibody.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Qualitative analysis based on immunostaining intensity and localization patterns.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Uniform mitochondrial localization in >90% of cells
